question: My wife is a diabetic of type II since 2004. In the year 2007 her tryglycerides level shown  202. the doctor prescribed her to take atovostatin 5 mg one tab a day. since then she is taking and now her tryglycerides level is 134. Please advise  whether  she can  discontinue the drug or does she has to continue for ever.Also please advise me whether she can disocntinue the drug ASA 50 mg  which she is taking since an year.
title: Diabetes and use of atorvostatin
